Posted By: Paolino (1/12/2012 3:13:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Interesting, it's the ultimate instant tutor. Of course, you need to own the card. I wonder if you could end up with more than 4 of a card with this? If it were for ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol), rather than ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol), it would be much more interesting, since you could put it on a stick with [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter). Still, a very fun idea. Grabbing super-specific strategy counters is pretty nasty stuff, but there's not much offensively that you could do from what I know. Worth it for the flavor alone, and the priceless expression when your opponent learns that it isn't, in fact, an unhinged card.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This thing wins games in my blue/green deck. I just stuff a sideboard full of excellent instants.  
  
My Blue/Green deck sideboard consists of: [Moment's Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moment's Peace), [Evacuation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evacuation), [Hurkyl's Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurkyl's Recall) (so evil), [Fracturing Gust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fracturing Gust), [Snakeform](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snakeform), [Vitalizing Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vitalizing Wind), [Reclaim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reclaim), [Twincast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twincast), [Turnabout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turnabout), [Pact of Negation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pact of Negation), [Spectral Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Shift), [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave), [Voidslime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voidslime), [Mystical Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mystical Tutor), and [Chord of Calling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chord of Calling).  
  
One of the favorite things that I love to do is [Cunning Wish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cunning Wish) at the end of my opponent's turn for [Mystical Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mystical Tutor) and search for something like [Time Stretch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stretch) or [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) and put it on top.  
  
Also, fetching a [Mirrorw](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorw)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

One of the favorite things that I love to do is Cunning Wish at the end of my opponent's turn for Mystical Tutor and search for something like Time Stretch or Rite of Replication and put it on top.

Posted By: Paolino (1/12/2012 3:13:48 AM)
Rating:

@Yozuk
Wish spells don't work in EDH, according to the official rules for that format. Wishes can only be used if sideboards are being used, and can only fetch cards from the sideboard, and from what I gather the rules for the sideboard are the same as for the main deck.

@BastianQoU
According to the Comprehensive Rules, "When a rule or text on a card refers to a "card," it means only a _Magic_ card. Most _Magic_ games use only traditional _Magic_ cards, which measure approximately 2.5 inches (6.3 cm) by 3.5 inches (8.8 cm)." (CR 108.2)

Posted By: 001010011100101110 (8/25/2011 10:23:02 PM)
Rating:

Pity this doesn't work with exiled cards anymore.
When the "Exile Zone" was still the "Removed from the Game-Zone", this zone was considered 'outside from the game', so you could get instants that exiled themselves upon use. Like Cunning Wish! :P
Or a card that you exiled with Force of Will.

@DarthParallax: Sadly there won't be any hammer time, even MC Hammer can cast this hammer only during the main phase since it's a sorcery and not an instant.

@thisisnotmyname: How are you supposed to do that? You'd either have to counter with something that you don't have in your hand yet or to target something that isn't on the stack anymore! Oo
